Maracas Analyzing the impact of libraries evolution

About

What Is Maracas?

Maracas is a source code and bytecode analysis framework⁠—written in Java with the help of Spoon—designed to analyze how Java libraries evolve and how their evolution impacts their clients. Maracas is built atop JApiCmp, a static analysis tool that computes the delta between two JAR (Java ARchive) files of a Java project. Thanks to JApiCmp, Maracas computes the list of breaking changes introduced between two versions of a library, and⁠—with the help of Spoon⁠—detects broken uses on client code.

Related Projects

Below, we list some relevant projects that are being used by Maracas.

  • JApiCmp: static analysis tool that computes a delta between two JARs.
  • Spoon: static analysis tool that analyzes, rewrites, and transforms Java source code.
